issue.title: Buoyancy plugin improvement for flat ocean and standard shapes

content.raw: @{557058:6c52d6e5-77e0-41a8-8b6e-cb9462f4d5f1} I am having a hard time calculating submersed volume of geometries rotated about roll and pitch.  In the issue you said that “the buoyancy object is always considered to be oriented perpendicular to the water surface.” Does this mean that the link they these objects are associated with will never have a roll or pitch \(aka these objects will always be perpendicular\)?
